head.title: Metro Briefing | New Jersey: Newark: Youth Worker Charged With Abuse

hedline.hl1: Metro Briefing | New Jersey: Newark: Youth Worker Charged With Abuse
hedline.hl2: Newark: Youth Worker Charged With Abuse

body.head.byline: By JOHN HOLL; Compiled by John Sullivan

abstract.p: Lawrence Tyler is charged with molesting 11-year-old girl whose Newark, NJ, family he had befriended (S)

block.p: Investigators for the Essex County prosecutor have arrested an Irvington man who worked for a youth program financed by the state and charged him with molesting an 11-year-old girl whose family he befriended. The man, Lawrence Tyler, 56, worked for the Youth Advocacy Program, a private agency that has a state contract. He was arrested at his home late Friday night and charged with five counts of sexual assault and five counts of endangering the welfare of a child, said Mark Ali, director of the county's Child Abuse Unit. Mr. Tyler had been working for the girl's uncle, Mr. Ali said.

He was arrested at his home late Friday night and charged with five counts of sexual assault and five counts of endangering the welfare of a child, said Mark Ali, director of the county’s Child Abuse Unit. Mr. Tyler had been working for the girl’s uncle, Mr. Ali said.
